emuInput.TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Wilhelmina Cooper, Mildred Arnett, Luther Dupree, Oliver Dent, Lillian Allen Carter, Elizabeth Ballard, and Rev. and Mrs. L. E. Dukes, posed in Bethel Baptist Church for Wilhelmina's Feast and Fair, Braddock
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 27, 1965, pg. 15 reads: "Wilhelmina At Braddock's Bethel - Sunday, March 21, was Homecoming Day at Braddock's Bethel Baptist Church. it was also the day Wilhelmina came with her Food Fair to and fun, food and prizes in behalf of her sponsors, which are A&P Co., Pepsi-Cola, Gulf Oil, Vern Staley's Boulevard Dodge, Tri-Point Ice Cream, Jack's and Bachman Snacks, Drake's Bakery and The Pittsburgh Courier.  Left to right: Wilhelmina (Mrs. Wilhelmina Cooper), Mrs. Mildred Arnett, Luther Dupree, chairman for the day; Oliver Dent, a youngster who fell in love with the Jimmy Brown sign and asked for it; Lillian Allen Carter, wig specialist; Mrs. Elizabeth Ballard, a lucky winner, and the Rev. and MRs. L.E. Dukes, the pastor and his wife, who also won one of the prizes."
